subject: CLARIFICATION
body:
*Oshin Shahiean, Partner*

*OTS SOLICITORS*
60 CANNON STREET
LONDON EC4N 6NP
ENGLAND

Email: info@otschamber-uk.com
             attorneyoshinshahiean@gmail.com



*Attention: Mr. Craig *


Sir,

Thanks for your email, see below my clarification to the issues you raised.

1. The purpose of the form is to establish legally that you are the
rightful beneficiary to the said fund. Once these forms are filled and
notarized it closes the window for any other person or group of
persons/company to apply for this same fund or lay any claim whatsoever in
the future.

2. Stamp Duty and Court charges are fees that will be paid to the court for
the services they will render in the process of notarizing the forms.

3. It takes between 48 hours - 72 hours (2-3 days) for the forms to be
legalized from the day you make the payment for it.

4. Once the forms are legalized your payment will be transferred to you
within two working days.

I understand your position and there is absolutely nothing wrong with
asking for clarifications where you are  not conversant with the process.

I will be expecting the filled forms from you.

Sincerely,

*For: OTS SOLICITORS *

*Attorney  Oshin Shahiean*

subject: Re: CLARIFICATION
body:
Dear Mr. Oshin Shahiean,

Thank you for your prompt response. I appreciate your explanation regarding the purpose of the form and how it establishes my rightful claim to the fund. It's good to know that once the forms are filled and notarized, no one else can lay any claim in the future.

I understand that Stamp Duty and Court charges are necessary fees for the services provided by the court in notarizing the forms. Could you please provide me with more details about these fees? How much do they amount to, and how should I make the payment?

You mentioned that it takes between hours hours days for the forms to be legalized from the day of payment. Is there any specific reason why it takes this amount of time? I'm just curious to understand the process better.

Lastly, once the forms are legalized, you mentioned that my payment will be transferred to me within two working days. Could you clarify how this payment will be made? Will it be through a bank transfer or another method?

Thank you again for your assistance. I look forward to receiving further instructions on filling out the forms.

Best wishes,
Craig

subject: THE PROCESS
body:
*Oshin Shahiean, Partner*

*OTS SOLICITORS*
60 CANNON STREET
LONDON EC4N 6NP
ENGLAND

Email: info@otschamber-uk.com
             attorneyoshinshahiean@gmail.com



*Attention: Mr. Craig *


Sir,

I have received your email.

You need to fill the forms and return to me before I will tell you the
exact amount because I will take the forms to the court for vetting, it is
the vetting that will confirm the exact amount required so I can't do a
guess work now.

When I ascertain the exact amount I will issue you our broker's account so
you can wire the fee, if you can send it by bitcoin it is also acceptable
and even faster.

I said it takes days because I don't know the process you will prefer to
make the payment. If you wire the fee to us it will likely take 2 or 3 days
before we can receive it and if we receive it towards afternoon or evening
we may not do much the same day so it will be done the next day. But if we
receive the money before 10am UK time then the legalization of the forms
will be completed the same day.

Once the forms are legalized, we shall submit it to the bank for the
payment. The bank will take a day to sort out their internal processes and
by the next day they will release your payment. The payment will be done by
telegraphic transfer (TT).

This whole process will start by you completing the form and sending it to
us.


Sincerely,

*For: OTS SOLICITORS *

*Attorney  Oshin Shahiean*

subject: Re: THE PROCESS
body:
Dear Attorney Oshin Shahiean,

Thank you for your prompt response. I appreciate your willingness to help me with this matter. I understand that the exact amount required will be confirmed after the forms are vetted by the court. Could you please provide me with more information about these forms? What kind of information do they require?

Regarding the payment, I would prefer to wire the fee rather than using bitcoin. Could you please provide me with the necessary details for making the payment via wire transfer? Additionally, could you clarify how long it usually takes for the bank to release the payment once the forms are legalized and submitted?

I look forward to your reply.

Best wishes,
Craig

subject: Re: THE PROCESS
body:
Dear Mr. Shahiean,

Thank you for your prompt response. I appreciate your willingness to help me with this matter. I understand that the exact amount required will be confirmed after the forms are vetted by the court. Could you please provide me with more information about these forms? What kind of information do they require?

Regarding the payment, I would prefer to wire the fee rather than using bitcoin. Can you please provide me with the necessary details for making the payment through a wire transfer? Additionally, could you clarify how long it usually takes for the bank to release the payment once the forms are legalized and submitted?

I look forward to your reply.

Best wishes,
Craig

subject: TWO DAYS
body:
*Oshin Shahiean, Partner*

*OTS SOLICITORS*
60 CANNON STREET
LONDON EC4N 6NP
ENGLAND

Email: info@otschamber-uk.com
             attorneyoshinshahiean@gmail.com



*Attention: Mr. Craig *


Sir,

I have received your email.

I am surprised at your question. What do you want me to say about forms
that are written in english, it's simple, fill your name address telephone
numbers and the amount and attach or submit a valid identity, is there
anything that needs clarification on it again ?

When you submit the forms, we vet them to know the amount then we will
issue you with the receiving account. How can we send you the account now
when you haven't filled the forms, you don't even know the figure yet,
which one comes first ?

I told you already once the forms are legalized it will take a maximum of 2
days for the bank to wire your fund.


Sincerely,

*For: OTS SOLICITORS *

*Attorney  Oshin Shahiean*

subject: Re: TWO DAYS
body:
Dear Mr. Shahiean,

Thank you for your prompt response. I appreciate your explanation regarding the forms. I just wanted to make sure I understood the process correctly.

So, if I understand correctly, once I fill out the forms with my name, address, and telephone number, as well as attach or submit a valid identity document, you will then vet the forms to determine the amount. After that, you will provide me with the receiving account details. Is that correct?

I apologize for any confusion earlier. I now understand that it wouldn't make sense for you to send me the account details before I have filled out the forms and know the exact figure.

Regarding the timeframe, you mentioned that once the forms are legalized, it will take a maximum of days for the bank to wire my funds. Could you please clarify what you mean by "legalized"? Do I need to have them notarized or certified in any way?

Thank you again for your assistance.

Best wishes,
Craig

subject: FURTHER CLARIFICATION
body:
*Oshin Shahiean, Partner*

*OTS SOLICITORS*
60 CANNON STREET
LONDON EC4N 6NP
ENGLAND

Email: info@otschamber-uk.com
             attorneyoshinshahiean@gmail.com



*Attention: Mr. Craig *


Sir,

Yes you are correct about the form, the vetting and provision for the
receiving account.

I am glad that you now understand my explanation.

I already told you before that when you fill the form you will send it to
me then I will take it to the court for vetting to know the amount you need
to pay. When I get the figure and send it to you then you will wire the fee.

When you wire the fee I can then notarize the documents in the court here
and pay the applicable fee, that is the same thing as legalization and I
told you this in my previous email.

After legalizing the documents I will then take them to the bank for them
to wire your funds to you.

I hope you understand now.



Sincerely,

*For: OTS SOLICITORS *

*Attorney  Oshin Shahiean*

subject: Re: FURTHER CLARIFICATION
body:
Dear Mr. Shahiean,

Thank you for your response. I appreciate the clarification regarding the form and the process involved. It's good to know that once I fill out the form, I will send it to you for vetting by the court. Could you please explain what exactly is meant by "vetting" in this context? 

Additionally, I would like to know more about the fees involved. You mentioned that once I receive the figure from you, I will wire the fee. Could you provide me with an estimate of how much this fee might be? It would be helpful for me to have a clear understanding of the financial aspect before proceeding.

Once again, thank you for your assistance in guiding me through this process.

Best wishes,
Craig
